result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Megan A. Ziegel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Megan A. Ziegel
Current: 3658 Four Mile Rd, Marathon, WI 54448 United States  (Effective: 01-23-2017)
Prior: 128 Ross Avenue, Wausau, WI 54403

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM2046, 15CM2047 and 16CM872 called: 4:21pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person and with Atty Jack Bliss.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW. 

Defendant states her last name is O'Laughlin now.

State moves to:
15CM2047>>D&RI entire file
15CM2046>>D&RI entire file
16CM872 - Cts. 2 and 3>>Both D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
16CM872 - Ct. 1 (Misd BJ)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 1 year Probation
  CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Absolute sobriety; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.

Defendant must report to Probation department tomorrow by 4:30pm (5/26/16)

Adj: 4:30pm
for the Production of Exculpatory Evidence - Defendant's
and Demand for Discovery & Inspection - Defendant's
Pre-trial conference on April 8, 2016 at 08:35 am.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM2046 and 15CM2047 called: 9:52am
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant appears in person/pro se.

State notes that discussion with Atty Mazza this morning - Defendant no longer has him representing her.
COURT directs matter to be set for PTC in 2 weeks; COURT directs defendant must go to PD's office after setting that PTC today, and check on status of them representing her (She had seen them in November, and they are waiting for further information from defendant, which defendant states was mailed to the PD's office last week).

Bond continues.

Adj: 9:54am

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM2047 and 15CM2046 called: 2:50pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person/pro se.

State notes defendant has now retained representation - Defendant states Attorney Theodore Mazza from Heartland is representing her.
COURT questions defendant why Atty Mazza is not here, and that no Notice of Representation has been filed with COURT on criminal cases.
COURT recesses for defendant to call Atty Mazza to obtain information on his representation 2:53pm
BOTR: 2:59pm - State notes he spoke w/Atty Mazza, and Atty Mazza has been retained on both of these cases, and is aware of the next 2 court dates.
Bond continues.

Adj: 3:00pm

Shall not consume alcohol.   No contact with victim(s): A.M. & A.M. - NO abusive contact: P.C. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
